content:
The indefinite integral of 1/x is given by the formula:

ln |x| + C

Where C is a constant. To find the definite integral of 1/x from x=1 to x=2, you can evaluate the definite integral using this formula by substituting the upper and lower limits of integration into the indefinite integral and taking the difference:

integral from x=1 to x=2 of (1/x) dx = ln |2| - ln |1|
= ln 2 - ln 1
= ln 2

So the definite integral of 1/x from x=1 to x=2 is equal to ln 2.
